summary: ICP canister-based web app being deployed with a working production link; branding update to use the user-provided logo as the main app logo (header + PWA icon).
architectural_notes: Deployment links must resolve to an active canister; production URL should be regenerated/redeployed when canister ID is invalid/expired.
known_issues: Current production link returns HTTP 400 'Canister ID Not Resolved'.
App logo not reflecting the user-provided final logo (needs to be applied to header and PWA icon).
imageRequirements:
## Edit Images
- Replace the existing logo artwork with the user-provided IMG_4299-3.jpeg (app-logo.dim_512x512.png > app-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Replace the existing app icon artwork with the user-provided IMG_4299-3.jpeg (app-icon.dim_192x192.png > app-icon.dim_192x192.png)
- Replace the existing app icon artwork with the user-provided IMG_4299-3.jpeg (app-icon.dim_512x512.png > app-icon.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Replace the appâ€™s branding assets with the user-uploaded logo image (IMG_4299-3.jpeg) by regenerating the static PNG files used by the UI and PWA so the new logo appears in the header, browser favicon, and installed PWA icon.
Force installed PWAs and offline users to receive the updated branding assets by bumping the service worker cache version and ensuring the logo/icon assets remain in the precache list.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix production link returning 400 'Canister ID Not Resolved' by redeploying/regenerating a valid canister URL
Apply uploaded logo as final main app logo including header and PWA icon
Rebuild and redeploy the application to production to provide a fresh working icp0.io URL that does not return HTTP 400 'Canister ID Not Resolved'.

projectName: Apply uploaded logo to header + PWA icons and redeploy to fix canister link
